Authors: Juan Francisco Morales, Mary E. Endress, Sigrid Liede
Title:
Systematics of Prestonia (Apocynaceae: Apocynoideae:
Echiteae)
Keywords:
apocynoids, classification, ITS, molecular phylogeny,
Prestoniinae, systematics
Abstract:
Prestonia (Apocynoideae, Echiteae) comprises ca. 58
species, which are lianas, with eglandular leaves, axillary or terminal
cymose inflorescences, sepals with a single colleter, flowers with
coronal structures (annular corona around the mouth and free coronal
lobes), follicular fruits and truncate seeds, comose at the microphylar
apex. Three infrageneric classifications have been proposed in the last
110 years, all of them based on morphological characters and none of
which have been tested with molecular data. In the present study, xxx
nuclear and xxx chloroplast sequences from 50 species were analyzed in
order to test the infrageneric classifications proposed for Prestonia,
including representatives of all the sections ever proposed, as well to
confirm the monophyly of the genus with a larger sample compared to
previous studies. Prestonia was shown to be monophyletic, but all the
infrageneric sections proposed by Schumann, Woodson and Pichon are
non-monophyletic. Based on our results, we proposed a new infrageneric
classification for Prestonia, recognizing seven sections: Annulares,
Coalita, Denticulata, Exserta, Molles, Prestonia. Prestonia pickelii
Markgr. is recognized again as an accepted species and removed from the
synonymy of P. quinquangularis.
